meanings.definition: A mask or disguise worn to conceal one's true identity.
meanings.sent1: At the costume party, many people wore falsefaces to look like superheroes.
meanings.sent2: The actor put on a falsefaces to play the role of a famous historical figure.
meanings.sent3: The falsefaces made everyone at the party guess who was behind each mask.
meanings.sent4: Her falsefaces of happiness hid the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The falsefaces transformed the shy student into a confident performer on stage.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be someone or something one is not.
meanings.sent1: During the game of make-believe, the children would falsefaces as pirates on a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to falsefaces her true feelings, so she decided to be honest with her friend.
meanings.sent3: The comedian would falsefaces as different characters to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: In order to fit in, he would falsefaces his interests to match those of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to falsefaces as a tourist to gather information without being detected.

meanings.sent1: The market was flooded with falsefaces designer handbags that looked real but were fake.
meanings.sent2: She received a falsefaces invitation to the exclusive event, but she knew it was not legitimate.
meanings.sent3: The falsefaces jewelry sparkled in the sunlight, fooling many into thinking it was real.
meanings.sent4: His falsefaces smile did not reach his eyes, revealing his true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The falsefaces painting was so well done that it was hard to tell it was a copy.
